00001 //  MeCab -- Yet Another Part-of-Speech and Morphological Analyzer
00002 //
00003 //  $Id: mempool.h 173 2009-04-18 08:10:57Z taku-ku $;
00004 //
00005 //  Copyright(C) 2001-2006 Taku Kudo <taku@chasen.org>

00007 #ifndef MECAB_MEM_POOL_H
00008 #define MECAB_MEM_POOL_H
00009 
00010 #include <map>
00011 #ifndef MECAB_WITHOUT_SHARE_DIC
00012 
00013 #include "mutex.h"
00014 
00015 #define MMAP_OPEN(type, map, file, mode) do {                   \
00016     MemoryPool<std::string, Mmap<type> >& pool__ =              \
00017         getMemoryPool<std::string, Mmap<type> >();              \
00018     map = pool__.get((file));                                   \
00019     pool__.lock();                                              \
00020     if (map->begin() == 0 && !map->open(file.c_str(), mode)) {  \
00021       WHAT << map->what();                                      \
00022       close();                                                  \
00023       pool__.unlock();                                          \
00024       return false;                                             \
00025     }                                                           \
00026     pool__.unlock();                                            \
00027   } while (0)
00028 
00029 #define MMAP_CLOSE(type, map) do {                      \
00030     MemoryPool<std::string, Mmap<type> >& pool__ =      \
00031         getMemoryPool<std::string, Mmap<type> >();      \
00032     pool__.release(map);                                \
00033     map = 0; } while (0)
00034 
00035 namespace MeCab {
00036 
00037 template <typename _Key, typename _Value> class MemoryPool {
00038  private:
00039   std::map<_Key, _Value*> pool_;
00040   std::map<_Value*, std::pair<_Key, size_t> > rpool_;
00041   Mutex mutex_;
00042 
00043  public:
00044   typedef _Key   key_type;
00045   typedef _Value value_type;
00046 
00047   explicit MemoryPool() {}
00048 
00049   virtual ~MemoryPool() {
00050     mutex_.lock();
00051     for (typename std::map<_Key, _Value*>::iterator it = pool_.begin();
00052          it != pool_.end(); it++)
00053       delete it->second;
00054     mutex_.unlock();
00055   }
00056 
00057   void lock() { mutex_.lock(); }
00058   void unlock() { mutex_.unlock(); }
00059 
00060   value_type* get(const key_type &key) {
00061     mutex_.lock();
00062 
00063     typename std::map<_Key, _Value*>::iterator it = pool_.find(key);
00064     _Value* m = 0;
00065 
00066     if (it == pool_.end()) {
00067       m = new _Value;
00068       pool_.insert(std::make_pair(key, m));
00069       rpool_[m] = std::make_pair(key, static_cast<size_t>(1));
00070     } else {
00071       m = it->second;
00072       rpool_[m].second++;  // reference count;
00073     }
00074 
00075     mutex_.unlock();
00076 
00077     return m;
00078   }
00079 
00080   void release(value_type *m = 0) {
00081     mutex_.lock();
00082 
00083     if (m) {
00084       typename std::map<_Value*, std::pair<_Key, size_t> >::iterator
00085           it = rpool_.find(m);
00086       if (it != rpool_.end()) {
00087         --it->second.second;
00088         if (it->second.second == 0) {
00089           typename std::map<_Key, _Value*>::iterator it2 =
00090               pool_.find(it->second.first);
00091           pool_.erase(it2);
00092           rpool_.erase(it);
00093           delete m;
00094           m = 0;
00095         }
00096       }
00097     }
00098 
00099     mutex_.unlock();
00100   }
00101 };
00102 
00103 template <class _Key, class _Value> MemoryPool<_Key, _Value>&
00104 getMemoryPool() {
00105   static MemoryPool<_Key, _Value> mempool;
00106   return mempool;
00107 }
00108 }
00109 
00110 #else
00111 
00112 #define MMAP_OPEN(type, map, file) do {         \
00113     map = new Mmap<type>;                       \
00114     if (!map->open(file.c_str())) {             \
00115       WHAT(map->what());                        \
00116       close();                                  \
00117       return false;                             \
00118     }                                           \
00119   } while (0)
00120 
00121 #define MMAP_CLOSE(type, map) do {              \
00122     delete map; } while (0)
00123 
00124 #endif
00125 #endif
